Single-Effect Screening (GLM / Cox)

Source: R/Rinternal.R
single_effect_fit.Rd

For each column of X, fits a univariate model (GLM via stats::glm() or Cox PH via survival::coxph(), selected by family), computes per-variable statistics (coef, SE, p-values, BIC, evidence), converts BIC-based evidence to Bayes factors and posterior model probabilities (PMP) using a numerically stable softmax, and optionally applies shrinkage tests using likelihood-ratio tests on the expected coefficients.

Arguments

X

An \(n \times p\) numeric matrix of predictors.

y

For GLM: numeric vector of length \(n\). For Cox: either an \(n \times 2\) matrix (time, status) or a list list(time, status).

family

GLM family object (e.g., binomial(), gaussian(), poisson()), or the string "cox" to use Cox PH.

offset

Optional numeric vector of length \(n\), or scalar; if scalar, it is expanded to length \(n\).

standardize

Logical, kept for API compatibility (inner fits use R modeling).

shrinkage

Logical; if TRUE, zero out expect_* entries when the corresponding LRT p-value exceeds alpha.

ties

Cox ties handling: "efron" (default) or "breslow".

lambda, tau

Numeric; kept for API compatibility (not used by glm/cox wrappers).

alpha

Numeric in (0,1); significance level for shrinkage tests (default 0.05).

Value

A list with components (all length \(p\) unless noted):

  • loglik: log-likelihood for each single-variable model.

  • bic: BIC of each single-variable model.

  • bic_diff: BIC1 - BIC0 (global null BIC).

  • bf: Bayes factors via stabilized exp(0.5 * evidence).

  • pmp: posterior model probabilities (softmax over evidence).

  • intercept: intercept estimates (0 for Cox).

  • theta: slope estimates from univariate fits.

  • se_theta: standard errors of theta.

  • pval_raw: Wald (GLM) or LRT (Cox) p-values from univariate fits.

  • pval_intercept: LRT p-values for intercept (expectation test).

  • pval_theta: LRT p-values for slope (expectation test).

  • evidence: twoLogBF ≈ BIC0 - BIC1 per variable.

  • evidence_raw: same as evidence (kept for compatibility).

  • expect_intercept: PMP-weighted intercept per variable (post-shrinkage).

  • expect_theta: PMP-weighted slope per variable (post-shrinkage).

  • expect_variance: scalar Var_pmp(theta).

Examples

set.seed(1)
n <- 200; p <- 5
X <- matrix(rnorm(n*p), n, p)
beta <- c(1, 0, 0.5, 0, 0)
eta  <- 0.2 + X %*% beta
y    <- rbinom(n, 1, plogis(eta))
out  <- single_effect_fit(X, y, binomial(), offset = rep(0, n))
str(out$pmp)
#>  num [1:5, 1] 1.00 4.21e-10 8.28e-08 1.07e-09 3.40e-10
